name: Thiago Paixão
description: Thiago Meireles Paixão is a Brazilian Computer Science professor at the Federal Institute of Espírito Santo – Campus Serra (IFES-SERRA), where he has served with exclusive dedication since 2016. He holds a Bachelor's in Computer Science (UFMG, 2006), a Master's (USP, 2010), and a PhD in Informatics (UFES, 2022), which included a research internship at École de Technologie Supérieure in Montreal, Canada, supported by CAPES. His doctoral work focused on deep learning techniques for reconstructing shredded documents.

His research spans computer vision, image and video processing, structural pattern recognition, and machine learning, with a growing focus on generative AI and data analysis. He contributes to major applied research projects such as Grávida Digital (in partnership with FMUSP) and predictive modeling for blast furnace temperature (with ArcelorMittal and FAPES). Thiago is also a member of the Institute of Applied Computational Intelligence (I2CA), which fosters innovation in intelligent systems and autonomous vehicles in collaboration with academic and industrial partners like Vale, Embraer, and ArcelorMittal.
